feature_name: Remove homepage quick guide and CTA button cluster
scope_summary: Remove the Quick guide section on the main homepage including guide/toggle explainer copy and the two call-to-action buttons so the page returns to a simpler level-one presentation.

legal_and_regulatory.rationale: Pure homepage content/layout removal with no legal policy or data-collection scope changes.

privacy_local_first_promise.rationale: No data handling behavior changed by this homepage content removal.
evidence: No scripts, storage, or API behavior changes introduced

medical_scope_and_claims.rationale: No medical claims were added or expanded.

behavioral_science_alignment.rationale: This change reduces top-level cognitive load by removing optional control documentation from homepage view.
evidence: Quick guide explainer module removed from index page

neurodivergence_research_alignment.rationale: Simplifying initial landing content can reduce overwhelm for users who only need the level-one page entry experience.
evidence: Install/guide/button cluster removed from homepage flow

user_benefit_and_harm_check.rationale: Users get a cleaner homepage with less clutter; downside is only reduced immediate discoverability for guide links.
evidence: Guide and hub CTA buttons removed from index page

brand_voice_and_claims.rationale: The remaining homepage voice stays consistent and less noisy while preserving core brand framing.
evidence: Change is subtraction of optional guidance block

accessibility_and_inclusion.rationale: Removing non-essential elements reduces scan complexity on the landing page.
evidence: Large multi-card guide block no longer competes with primary sections

security_and_reliability.rationale: Static HTML-only adjustment with no runtime risk introduced.
evidence: No JavaScript or routing changes made

ship_decision.conditions: Deploy and verify homepage no longer shows Quick guide or guide/open-hub button block.
